As per their website: GPT-4 with Vision, sometimes referred to as GPT-4V or gpt-4-vision-preview in the API, allows the model to take in images and answer […]

step.name: Navigate to Image tab
step.text: Navigate to the 'Image' tab in Optizen AI. Search via name or using tags for the product or products you wish to update images. Use the check boxes to select the products. Click 'Next'

step.name: Configure schedule settings
step.text: Give the schedule a name for reference. Select from the dropdown: auto, low or high detail setting based on your image requirements

step.name: Select and configure prompt
step.text: Select the prompt you want to use from drop down under the Image ALT prompt field. You can choose provided prompts, edit them, or write your own. Check the box for 'Update this section'. Then click Proceed

step.name: Run and review
step.text: Click Proceed to run the prompt. On completion, check the output using the Log section of the app. You can then choose to keep or restore the update

mainEntity.name: What technology does OptizenAI use to update image alt attributes?

acceptedAnswer.text: OptizenAI uses OpenAI Vision (GPT-4 with Vision) to scan product images and describe them in the form of alt text attributes

mainEntity.name: Why does updating images take longer than product updates?

acceptedAnswer.text: Updating images takes longer due to the extra time it takes to read the images, and also the multiple images each product may have

mainEntity.name: When should you use the 'high' setting instead of 'low'?

acceptedAnswer.text: The 'high' setting can provide more accurate output if your images have text, for example on a product label, or text on a t-shirt

mainEntity.name: What happens if you choose the 'high' detail setting?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you choose high, it will be slightly more expensive as it uses twice the token budget (65 tokens) for a total of 129 tokens

@graph.name: GPT-4V
@graph.description: GPT-4 with Vision, sometimes referred to as gpt-4-vision-preview in the API, allows the model to take in images and answer questions about them

@graph.name: Low detail setting
@graph.description: Disables the 'high res' model, receives a low-res 512px x 512px version of the image with a budget of 65 tokens

@graph.name: High detail setting
@graph.description: Enables 'high res' mode, allows the model to see the low res image and creates detailed crops of input images as 512px squares

@graph.name: Auto setting
@graph.description: Default setting that looks at the image input size and decides whether to use the low or high setting
